00077 // Deprecated library function hell. Compilers want to use the
00078 // new safe versions. This probably doesn't fully address the problem,
00079 // but it gets closer. There are too many compilers for me to fully
00080 // test. If you get compilation troubles, undefine TIXML_SAFE
00081 
00082 #define TIXML_SAFE      // TinyXml isn't fully buffer overrun protected, safe code. This is work in progress.
00083 #ifdef TIXML_SAFE
00084     #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1400 )
00085         // Microsoft visual studio, version 2005 and higher.
00086         #define TIXML_SNPRINTF _snprintf_s
00087         #define TIXML_SNSCANF  _snscanf_s
00088     #elif defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1200 )
00089         // Microsoft visual studio, version 6 and higher.
00090         //#pragma message( "Using _sn* functions." )
00091         #define TIXML_SNPRINTF _snprintf
00092         #define TIXML_SNSCANF  _snscanf
00093     #elif defined(__GNUC__) && (__GNUC__ >= 3 )
00094         // GCC version 3 and higher.s
00095         //#warning( "Using sn* functions." )
00096         #define TIXML_SNPRINTF snprintf
00097         #define TIXML_SNSCANF  snscanf
00098     #endif
00099 #endif

00115 /*  Internal structure for tracking location of items
00116     in the XML file.
00117 */
00118 struct TiXmlCursor
00119 {
00120     TiXmlCursor()       { Clear(); }
00121     void Clear()        { row = col = -1; }
00122 
00123     int row;    // 0 based.
00124     int col;    // 0 based.
00125 };

00271     static const char*  SkipWhiteSpace( const char*, TiXmlEncoding encoding );
00272     inline static bool  IsWhiteSpace( char c )
00273     {
00274         return ( isspace( (unsigned char) c ) || c == '\n' || c == '\r' );
00275     }
00276     inline static bool  IsWhiteSpace( int c )
00277     {
00278         if ( c < 256 )
00279             return IsWhiteSpace( (char) c );
00280         return false;   // Again, only truly correct for English/Latin...but usually works.
00281     }

00292         a pointer just past the last character of the name,
00293         or 0 if the function has an error.
00294     */
00295     static const char* ReadName( const char* p, TIXML_STRING* name, TiXmlEncoding encoding );
00296 
00297     /*  Reads text. Returns a pointer past the given end tag.
00298         Wickedly complex options, but it keeps the (sensitive) code in one place.
00299     */
00300     static const char* ReadText(    const char* in,             // where to start
00301                                     TIXML_STRING* text,         // the string read
00302                                     bool ignoreWhiteSpace,      // whether to keep the white space
00303                                     const char* endTag,         // what ends this text
00304                                     bool ignoreCase,            // whether to ignore case in the end tag
00305                                     TiXmlEncoding encoding );   // the current encoding
00306 
00307     // If an entity has been found, transform it into a character.
00308     static const char* GetEntity( const char* in, char* value, int* length, TiXmlEncoding encoding );
00309 
00310     // Get a character, while interpreting entities.
00311     // The length can be from 0 to 4 bytes.
00312     inline static const char* GetChar( const char* p, char* _value, int* length, TiXmlEncoding encoding )
00313     {
00314         assert( p );
00315         if ( encoding == TIXML_ENCODING_UTF8 )
00316         {
00317             *length = utf8ByteTable[ *((unsigned char*)p) ];
00318             assert( *length >= 0 && *length < 5 );
00319         }
00320         else
00321         {
00322             *length = 1;
00323         }
00324 
00325         if ( *length == 1 )
00326         {
00327             if ( *p == '&' )
00328                 return GetEntity( p, _value, length, encoding );
00329             *_value = *p;
00330             return p+1;
00331         }
00332         else if ( *length )
00333         {
00334             //strncpy( _value, p, *length );    // lots of compilers don't like this function (unsafe),
00335                                                 // and the null terminator isn't needed
00336             for( int i=0; p[i] && i<*length; ++i ) {
00337                 _value[i] = p[i];
00338             }
00339             return p + (*length);
00340         }
00341         else
00342         {
00343             // Not valid text.
00344             return 0;
00345         }
00346     }
00347 
00348     // Puts a string to a stream, expanding entities as it goes.
00349     // Note this should not contian the '<', '>', etc, or they will be transformed into entities!
00350     static void PutString( const TIXML_STRING& str, TIXML_OSTREAM* out );
00351 
00352     static void PutString( const TIXML_STRING& str, TIXML_STRING* out );

00354     // Return true if the next characters in the stream are any of the endTag sequences.
00355     // Ignore case only works for english, and should only be relied on when comparing
00356     // to English words: StringEqual( p, "version", true ) is fine.
00357     static bool StringEqual(    const char* p,
00358                                 const char* endTag,
00359                                 bool ignoreCase,
00360                                 TiXmlEncoding encoding );

00369     // None of these methods are reliable for any language except English.
00370     // Good for approximation, not great for accuracy.
00371     static int IsAlpha( unsigned char anyByte, TiXmlEncoding encoding );
00372     static int IsAlphaNum( unsigned char anyByte, TiXmlEncoding encoding );
00373     inline static int ToLower( int v, TiXmlEncoding encoding )
00374     {
00375         if ( encoding == TIXML_ENCODING_UTF8 )
00376         {
00377             if ( v < 128 ) return tolower( v );
00378             return v;
00379         }
00380         else
00381         {
00382             return tolower( v );
00383         }
00384     }
00385     static void ConvertUTF32ToUTF8( unsigned long input, char* output, int* length );
00386

00724 class TiXmlAttribute : public TiXmlBase
00725 {
00726     friend class TiXmlAttributeSet;
00727 
00728 public:
00730     TiXmlAttribute() : TiXmlBase()
00731     {
00732         document = 0;
00733         prev = next = 0;
00734     }
00735 
00736     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00738     TiXmlAttribute( const std::string& _name, const std::string& _value )
00739     {
00740         name = _name;
00741         value = _value;
00742         document = 0;
00743         prev = next = 0;
00744     }
00745     #endif
00746 
00748     TiXmlAttribute( const char * _name, const char * _value )
00749     {
00750         name = _name;
00751         value = _value;
00752         document = 0;
00753         prev = next = 0;
00754     }
00755 
00756     const char*     Name()  const       { return name.c_str(); }        
00757     const char*     Value() const       { return value.c_str(); }       
00758     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00759     const std::string& ValueStr() const { return value; }               
00760     #endif
00761     int             IntValue() const;                                   
00762     double          DoubleValue() const;                                
00763 
00764     // Get the tinyxml string representation
00765     const TIXML_STRING& NameTStr() const { return name; }
00766 
00776     int QueryIntValue( int* _value ) const;
00778     int QueryDoubleValue( double* _value ) const;
00779 
00780     void SetName( const char* _name )   { name = _name; }               
00781     void SetValue( const char* _value ) { value = _value; }             
00782 
00783     void SetIntValue( int _value );                                     
00784     void SetDoubleValue( double _value );                               
00785 
00786     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00788     void SetName( const std::string& _name )    { name = _name; }
00790     void SetValue( const std::string& _value )  { value = _value; }
00791     #endif
00792 
00794     const TiXmlAttribute* Next() const;
00795     TiXmlAttribute* Next();
00797     const TiXmlAttribute* Previous() const;
00798     TiXmlAttribute* Previous();
00799 
00800     bool operator==( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs ) const { return rhs.name == name; }
00801     bool operator<( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs )  const { return name < rhs.name; }
00802     bool operator>( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs )  const { return name > rhs.name; }
00803 
00804     /*  Attribute parsing starts: first letter of the name
00805                          returns: the next char after the value end quote
00806     */
00807     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p, TiXmlParsingData* data, TiXmlEncoding encoding );
00808 
00809     // Prints this Attribute to a FILE stream.
00810     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00811 
00812     virtual void StreamOut( TIXML_OSTREAM * out ) const;
00813     virtual void FormattedStreamOut( TIXML_OSTREAM*, int ) const {}
00814 
00815     // [internal use]
00816     // Set the document pointer so the attribute can report errors.
00817     void SetDocument( TiXmlDocument* doc )  { document = doc; }
00818 
00819 private:
00820     TiXmlAttribute( const TiXmlAttribute& );                // not implemented.
00821     void operator=( const TiXmlAttribute& base );   // not allowed.
00822 
00823     TiXmlDocument*  document;   // A pointer back to a document, for error reporting.
00824     TIXML_STRING name;
00825     TIXML_STRING value;
00826     TiXmlAttribute* prev;
00827     TiXmlAttribute* next;
00828 };
00829 
00830 
00831 /*  A class used to manage a group of attributes.
00832     It is only used internally, both by the ELEMENT and the DECLARATION.
00833 
00834     The set can be changed transparent to the Element and Declaration
00835     classes that use it, but NOT transparent to the Attribute
00836     which has to implement a next() and previous() method. Which makes
00837     it a bit problematic and prevents the use of STL.
00838 
00839     This version is implemented with circular lists because:
00840         - I like circular lists
00841         - it demonstrates some independence from the (typical) doubly linked list.
00842 */
00843 class TiXmlAttributeSet
00844 {
00845 public:
00846     TiXmlAttributeSet();
00847     ~TiXmlAttributeSet();
00848 
00849     void Add( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00850     void Remove( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00851 
00852     const TiXmlAttribute* First()   const   { return ( sentinel.next == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.next; }
00853     TiXmlAttribute* First()                 { return ( sentinel.next == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.next; }
00854     const TiXmlAttribute* Last() const      { return ( sentinel.prev == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.prev; }
00855     TiXmlAttribute* Last()                  { return ( sentinel.prev == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.prev; }
00856 
00857     const TiXmlAttribute*   Find( const TIXML_STRING& name ) const;
00858     TiXmlAttribute* Find( const TIXML_STRING& name );
00859 
00860 private:
00861     //*ME:  Because of hidden/disabled copy-construktor in TiXmlAttribute (sentinel-element),
00862     //*ME:  this class must be also use a hidden/disabled copy-constructor !!!
00863     TiXmlAttributeSet( const TiXmlAttributeSet& );  // not allowed
00864     void operator=( const TiXmlAttributeSet& ); // not allowed (as TiXmlAttribute)
00865 
00866     TiXmlAttribute sentinel;
00867 };
00868 
00869 
00874 class TiXmlElement : public TiXmlNode
00875 {
00876 public:
00878     TiXmlElement (const char * in_value);
00879 
00880     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00882     TiXmlElement( const std::string& _value );
00883     #endif
00884 
00885     TiXmlElement( const TiXmlElement& );
00886 
00887     void operator=( const TiXmlElement& base );
00888 
00889     virtual ~TiXmlElement();
00890 
00894     const char* Attribute( const char* name ) const;
00895 
00902     const char* Attribute( const char* name, int* i ) const;
00903 
00910     const char* Attribute( const char* name, double* d ) const;
00911 
00919     int QueryIntAttribute( const char* name, int* _value ) const;
00921     int QueryDoubleAttribute( const char* name, double* _value ) const;
00923     int QueryFloatAttribute( const char* name, float* _value ) const {
00924         double d;
00925         int result = QueryDoubleAttribute( name, &d );
00926         if ( result == TIXML_SUCCESS ) {
00927             *_value = (float)d;
00928         }
00929         return result;
00930     }
00931     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00932 
00938     template< typename T > int QueryValueAttribute( const std::string& name, T* outValue ) const
00939     {
00940         const TiXmlAttribute* node = attributeSet.Find( name );
00941         if ( !node )
00942             return TIXML_NO_ATTRIBUTE;
00943 
00944         std::stringstream sstream( node->ValueStr() );
00945         sstream >> *outValue;
00946         if ( !sstream.fail() )
00947             return TIXML_SUCCESS;
00948         return TIXML_WRONG_TYPE;
00949     }
00950     #endif
00951 
00955     void SetAttribute( const char* name, const char * _value );
00956 
00957     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00958     const char* Attribute( const std::string& name ) const              { return Attribute( name.c_str() ); }
00959     const char* Attribute( const std::string& name, int* i ) const      { return Attribute( name.c_str(), i ); }
00960     const char* Attribute( const std::string& name, double* d ) const   { return Attribute( name.c_str(), d ); }
00961     int QueryIntAttribute( const std::string& name, int* _value ) const { return QueryIntAttribute( name.c_str(), _value ); }
00962     int QueryDoubleAttribute( const std::string& name, double* _value ) const { return QueryDoubleAttribute( name.c_str(), _value ); }
00963 
00965     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, const std::string& _value );
00967     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, int _value );
00968     #endif
00969 
00973     void SetAttribute( const char * name, int value );
00974 
00978     void SetDoubleAttribute( const char * name, double value );
00979 
00982     void RemoveAttribute( const char * name );
00983     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00984     void RemoveAttribute( const std::string& name ) {   RemoveAttribute (name.c_str ());    }   
00985     #endif
00986 
00987     const TiXmlAttribute* FirstAttribute() const    { return attributeSet.First(); }        
00988     TiXmlAttribute* FirstAttribute()                { return attributeSet.First(); }
00989     const TiXmlAttribute* LastAttribute()   const   { return attributeSet.Last(); }     
00990     TiXmlAttribute* LastAttribute()                 { return attributeSet.Last(); }
00991 
01024     const char* GetText() const;
01025 
01027     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
01028     // Print the Element to a FILE stream.
01029     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
01030 
01031     /*  Attribtue parsing starts: next char past '<'
01032                          returns: next char past '>'
01033     */
01034     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p, TiXmlParsingData* data, TiXmlEncoding encoding );
01035 
01036     virtual const TiXmlElement*     ToElement()     const { return this; } 
01037     virtual TiXmlElement*           ToElement()           { return this; } 
01038 
01039 protected:
01040 
01041     void CopyTo( TiXmlElement* target ) const;
01042     void ClearThis();   // like clear, but initializes 'this' object as well
01043 
01044     // Used to be public [internal use]
01045     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
01046         virtual void StreamIn( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, TIXML_STRING * tag );
01047     #endif
01048     virtual void StreamOut( TIXML_OSTREAM * out ) const;
01049     virtual void FormattedStreamOut( TIXML_OSTREAM * stream, int depth ) const;
01050 
01051     /*  [internal use]
01052         Reads the "value" of the element -- another element, or text.
01053         This should terminate with the current end tag.
01054     */
01055     const char* ReadValue( const char* in, TiXmlParsingData* prevData, TiXmlEncoding encoding );
01056 
01057 private:
01058 
01059     TiXmlAttributeSet attributeSet;
01060 };

01380     {
01381         StringToBuffer f( filename );
01382         return ( f.buffer && LoadFile( f.buffer, encoding ));
01383     }

01385     {
01386         StringToBuffer f( filename );
01387         return ( f.buffer && SaveFile( f.buffer ));

01473                                                 errorId = 0;

01477                                             }

01591 class TiXmlHandle
01592 {
01593 public:
01595     TiXmlHandle( TiXmlNode* _node )                 { this->node = _node; }
01597     TiXmlHandle( const TiXmlHandle& ref )           { this->node = ref.node; }
01598     TiXmlHandle operator=( const TiXmlHandle& ref ) { this->node = ref.node; return *this; }
01599 
01601     TiXmlHandle FirstChild() const;
01603     TiXmlHandle FirstChild( const char * value ) const;
01605     TiXmlHandle FirstChildElement() const;
01607     TiXmlHandle FirstChildElement( const char * value ) const;
01608 
01612     TiXmlHandle Child( const char* value, int index ) const;
01616     TiXmlHandle Child( int index ) const;
01621     TiXmlHandle ChildElement( const char* value, int index ) const;
01626     TiXmlHandle ChildElement( int index ) const;
01627 
01628     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
01629     TiXmlHandle FirstChild( const std::string& _value ) const               { return FirstChild( _value.c_str() ); }
01630     TiXmlHandle FirstChildElement( const std::string& _value ) const        { return FirstChildElement( _value.c_str() ); }
01631 
01632     TiXmlHandle Child( const std::string& _value, int index ) const         { return Child( _value.c_str(), index ); }
01633     TiXmlHandle ChildElement( const std::string& _value, int index ) const  { return ChildElement( _value.c_str(), index ); }
01634     #endif
01635 
01637     TiXmlNode* Node() const         { return node; }
01639     TiXmlElement* Element() const   { return ( ( node && node->ToElement() ) ? node->ToElement() : 0 ); }
01641     TiXmlText* Text() const         { return ( ( node && node->ToText() ) ? node->ToText() : 0 ); }
01643     TiXmlUnknown* Unknown() const           { return ( ( node && node->ToUnknown() ) ? node->ToUnknown() : 0 ); }
01644 
01645 private:
01646     TiXmlNode* node;
01647 };
